info.title: Microsoft Learn Catalog
info.description: The Microsoft Learn Catalog allows you to send a web-based query to Microsoft Learn and get back details about all published Learn content, such as titles, products covered, levels, links to the training, and other metadata. You can then take this information and display it in your own site or learning management system (LMS) experience so that your users can access it just-in-time when doing a task or displayed side-by-side with other training content.

200.description: Success. The body of the response includes the JSON-encoded data.

duration_in_minutes.description: Duration of learning path in minutes.
duration_in_minutes.title: Duration

firstModuleUrl.title: First Module Url

number_of_children.title: Children

study_guide.title: Study Guide

renewal_frequency_in_days.title: Renewal Frequency

recommendation_list.title: Recommendation List

career_paths.title: Career Paths

get.description: This connector can return information from the Microsoft Learn Catalog about all publicly available Modules, Units, Learning Paths, Applied Skills, Certifications, Exams, Instructor-Led Courses.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: A single, valid locale code from the supported list of locales. The returned metadata will be in the requested locale if available. If this parameter isn't supplied, the en-us response will be returned. Example: en-us

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of one or more of the top-level content or taxonomies objects we currently provide in the response to return. Supported values are: modules, units, learningPaths, appliedSkills, certifications, mergedCertifications, exams, courses, levels, roles, products, subjects. Example: modules,learningPaths

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of one or more valid content unique IDs (uid) from the available content types. Note: uids are case-sensitive. Example: learn.azure.intro-to-azure-fundamentals

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: An operator and datetime to filter by the last modified date of objects. Operator includes lt (less than), lte (less than or equal to), eq (equal to), gt (greater than), gte (greater than or equal to). When you use this parameter, the operator will default to gte if not specified. Example: gte 2022-01-01

parameters.name: popularity
parameters.description: An operator and value to filter by the popularity value (in a range of 0-1) of objects. Operator includes lt (less than), lte (less than or equal to), eq (equal to), gt (greater than), gte (greater than or equal to). When you use this parameter, the operator will default to gte if not specified. Example: gte 0.5

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of one or more of the levels we currently have available. Supported values are: beginner, intermediate, advanced. Example: beginner

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of one or more of the roles we currently have available. Example: developer

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of one or more of the products we currently have available. The API does not support product hierarchy, so add every product to the list you want to include in your query. Example: azure

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of one or more of the subjects we currently have available. The API does not support subject hierarchy, so add every subject to the list you want to include in your query. Example: cloud-computing

x-ms-openai-manifest.modelDescription: This plugin can return information from the Microsoft Learn Catalog about all publicly available Modules, Units, Learning Paths, Applied Skills, Certifications, Exams, Instructor-Led Courses.
